5//
6// VertexArrayMtl.h:
7// Defines the class interface for VertexArrayMtl, implementing VertexArrayImpl.
8//
9
10#ifndef LIBANGLE_RENDERER_METAL_VERTEXARRAYMTL_H_
11#define LIBANGLE_RENDERER_METAL_VERTEXARRAYMTL_H_
12
13#include "libANGLE/renderer/VertexArrayImpl.h"
14#include "libANGLE/renderer/metal/BufferMtl.h"
15#include "libANGLE/renderer/metal/mtl_buffer_pool.h"
16#include "libANGLE/renderer/metal/mtl_command_buffer.h"
17#include "libANGLE/renderer/metal/mtl_format_utils.h"
18#include "libANGLE/renderer/metal/mtl_resources.h"
19
20namespace rx
21{
22class ContextMtl;
23
24class VertexArrayMtl : public VertexArrayImpl
25{
26 public:
27 VertexArrayMtl(const gl::VertexArrayState &state, ContextMtl *context);
28 ~VertexArrayMtl() override;
29
30 void destroy(const gl::Context *context) override;
31
32 angle::Result syncState(const gl::Context *context,
33 const gl::VertexArray::DirtyBits &dirtyBits,
34 gl::VertexArray::DirtyAttribBitsArray *attribBits,
35 gl::VertexArray::DirtyBindingBitsArray *bindingBits) override;
36
37 // Feed client side's vertex/index data
38 angle::Result updateClientAttribs(const gl::Context *context,
39 GLint firstVertex,
40 GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,
41 GLsizei instanceCount,
42 gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,
43 const void *indices);
44
45 // vertexDescChanged is both input and output, the input value if is true, will force new
46 // mtl::VertexDesc to be returned via vertexDescOut. This typically happens when active shader
47 // program is changed.
48 // Otherwise, it is only returned when the vertex array is dirty.
49 angle::Result setupDraw(const gl::Context *glContext,
50 mtl::RenderCommandEncoder *cmdEncoder,
51 bool *vertexDescChanged,
52 mtl::VertexDesc *vertexDescOut);
53
54 angle::Result getIndexBuffer(const gl::Context *glContext,
55 gl::DrawElementsType indexType,
56 size_t indexCount,
57 const void *sourcePointer,
58 mtl::BufferRef *idxBufferOut,
59 size_t *idxBufferOffsetOut,
60 gl::DrawElementsType *indexTypeOut);
61
62
63 std::vector<DrawCommandRange> getDrawIndices(const gl::Context *glContext,
64 gl::DrawElementsType originalIndexType,
65 gl::DrawElementsType indexType,
66 gl::PrimitiveMode primitiveMode,
67 uint32_t indexCount,
68 size_t offset);
69
70 // Use to emulate instanced draw for instance <instanceId>.
71 // The typical call sequence for emulated instance draw is:
72 // - setupDraw()
73 // - draw.
74 // - emulateInstanceDrawStep(1)
75 // - draw.
76 // - emulateInstanceDrawStep(n)
77 // - draw.
78 // - emulateInstanceDrawStep(0)
79 void emulateInstanceDrawStep(mtl::RenderCommandEncoder *cmdEncoder, uint32_t instanceId);
80
81 private:
82 void reset(ContextMtl *context);
83
84 void getVertexAttribFormatAndArraySize(const sh::ShaderVariable &var,
85 MTLVertexFormat *formatOut,
86 uint32_t *arraySizeOut);
87
88 angle::Result syncDirtyAttrib(const gl::Context *glContext,
89 const gl::VertexAttribute &attrib,
90 const gl::VertexBinding &binding,
91 size_t attribIndex);
92
93 angle::Result convertIndexBuffer(const gl::Context *glContext,
94 gl::DrawElementsType indexType,
95 size_t offset,
96 mtl::BufferRef *idxBufferOut,
97 size_t *idxBufferOffsetOut);
98 angle::Result streamIndexBufferFromClient(const gl::Context *glContext,
99 gl::DrawElementsType indexType,
100 size_t indexCount,
101 const void *sourcePointer,
102 mtl::BufferRef *idxBufferOut,
103 size_t *idxBufferOffsetOut);
104
105 angle::Result convertIndexBufferGPU(const gl::Context *glContext,
106 gl::DrawElementsType indexType,
107 BufferMtl *idxBuffer,
108 size_t offset,
109 size_t indexCount,
110 IndexConversionBufferMtl *conversion);
111
112 angle::Result convertVertexBuffer(const gl::Context *glContext,
113 BufferMtl *srcBuffer,
114 const gl::VertexBinding &binding,
115 size_t attribIndex,
116 const mtl::VertexFormat &vertexFormat);
117
118 angle::Result convertVertexBufferCPU(ContextMtl *contextMtl,
119 BufferMtl *srcBuffer,
120 const gl::VertexBinding &binding,
121 size_t attribIndex,
122 const mtl::VertexFormat &convertedFormat,
123 GLuint targetStride,
124 size_t vertexCount,
125 ConversionBufferMtl *conversion);
126 angle::Result convertVertexBufferGPU(const gl::Context *glContext,
127 BufferMtl *srcBuffer,
128 const gl::VertexBinding &binding,
129 size_t attribIndex,
130 const mtl::VertexFormat &convertedFormat,
131 GLuint targetStride,
132 size_t vertexCount,
133 bool isExpandingComponents,
134 ConversionBufferMtl *conversion);
135
136 // These can point to real BufferMtl or converted buffer in mConvertedArrayBufferHolders
137 gl::AttribArray<BufferHolderMtl *> mCurrentArrayBuffers;
138 gl::AttribArray<SimpleWeakBufferHolderMtl> mConvertedArrayBufferHolders;
139 gl::AttribArray<size_t> mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets;
140
141 // Size to be uploaded as inline constant data. Used for client vertex attribute's data that
142 // is small enough that we can send directly as inline constant data instead of streaming
143 // through a buffer.
144 gl::AttribArray<size_t> mCurrentArrayInlineDataSizes;
145 // Array of host buffers storing converted data for client attributes that are small enough.
146 gl::AttribArray<angle::MemoryBuffer> mConvertedClientSmallArrays;
147 gl::AttribArray<const uint8_t *> mCurrentArrayInlineDataPointers;
148 // Max size of inline constant data that can be used for client vertex attribute.
149 size_t mInlineDataMaxSize;
150
151 // Stride per vertex attribute
152 gl::AttribArray<GLuint> mCurrentArrayBufferStrides;
153 // Format per vertex attribute
154 gl::AttribArray<const mtl::VertexFormat *> mCurrentArrayBufferFormats;
155
156 const mtl::VertexFormat &mDefaultFloatVertexFormat;
157 const mtl::VertexFormat &mDefaultIntVertexFormat;
158 const mtl::VertexFormat &mDefaultUIntVertexFormat;
159
160 mtl::BufferPool mDynamicVertexData;
161 mtl::BufferPool mDynamicIndexData;
162
163 std::vector<uint32_t> mEmulatedInstanceAttribs;
164
165 bool mVertexArrayDirty = true;
166};
167} // namespace rx
168
169#endif /* LIBANGLE_RENDERER_METAL_VERTEXARRAYMTL_H_ */
170
